messages.message:
You're right! Multistep models search across documents and retrieve a limited number of chunks. The exact number can vary depending on the specific multistep model being used. You can find more details about their behavior, including how many chunks they fetch, here (https://docs.google.com/document/d/11HDjTmWqGFY1sx1QByIUTwAZX8Da1-lmZIWVmUeCbyA/edit?usp=sharing).

As the number of documents increases, these models may hit their limits and fail to provide comprehensive answers across all documents due to the constraints we apply on the amount of data they can process.
Thanks for sharing this Jay. Was wondering if we enable original limits, is there any difference to the limits that we place when doing converse/chat prompts?
As it clearly does not call out Chat/Converse, I am guessing, no, right?
Yeah, this shouldn't affect the chat/converse. The chunk limitations will be there regardless whether this is turned on or not for converse.
